error.signature: Glue job failed with error: An error occurred while calling the Spark driver
error.regex: (Glue job .+ (FAILED|failed)|An error occurred while calling .+ Spark|GlueJobRunException)

verdict.summary: AWS Glue ETL job failed due to script errors, data format issues, or resource limits.

dead_ends.action: Increase DPU count without checking the error type
dead_ends.why_fails: Most Glue failures are script logic or data format errors, not resource exhaustion

dead_ends.action: Switch from Glue to EMR to fix the issue
dead_ends.why_fails: The same Spark script will likely have the same data/logic errors on EMR

workarounds.action: Check CloudWatch logs for the Glue job run to find the specific error
Test the script locally or in a Glue development endpoint with sample data
workarounds.how: Use Glue interactive sessions or a local PySpark environment to debug with a small data sample

leads_to.condition: Glue role lacks permission to access source or target data stores

preceded_by.condition: IAM permission issues prevent Glue from reading source data

frequently_confused_with.distinction: EMR step failures are on self-managed Spark clusters; Glue job failures are on the serverless Glue ETL service
